articles.title: Goodbye PCs, it's been nice knowing you. Hello, desktop as a service
articles.synopsis: We'll still have PCs on our desks, but with the rise of desktop-as-a-service and software-as-a-service, we're returning to smart-terminals and time-sharing services.

articles.title: 9 Reasons Why You Should Keep Learning Machine Learning
articles.synopsis: Google says “Machine Learning is the future,” and the future of Machine Learning is going to be very bright. As humans become more addicted to machines, we’re witnesses to a new revolution that’s taking over the world, and that is going to be the future of Machine Learning...

events.title: Learn JavaScript! - Nashville, TN
events.description: Want to begin building web applications? Do you have aspirations of being a web developer? Or do you just want to learn more about coding to advance your existing career in marketing, project management or any other business that uses the internet on a daily basis?

events.title: Thinkful Webinar | Intro to Python: Fundamentals
events.description: Curious what Python is all about? Are you data-driven and interested in finding out how Python can take you to the next level? Join us for this hands-on workshop while we explore variables, data structures, functions, and go over basic data science concepts.

resources.title: Medium Article: Map, Reduce, and Filter
resources.description: Breaks down uses of Javascript Array methods, including map.

resources.title: Javascript Array Map Method
resources.description: All Arrays in JavaScript have a map method which allows us to loop through every element in the original array, perform some action and then generate a new Array based on our actions.

records.title: Definition
records.text: The map() method creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the calling array.

records.title: Syntax
Example
Useage
records.text: For Creating multiple objects of the same type. A good example would be creating a "Pizza Making" factory function that creates different types of pizzas based on the parameters entered for the function.

records.title: Solution
Purpose
records.text: This function transforms only even numbers using the map function and and conditional rendering. This is useful as a reference as to manipulate data, but also limit the data that is being manipulated in a single array.
